page.title: 07TUXFORD 2
page.content: toothbrush factory, sand blast cleaning company. On the L.N.E.R. railway the station (Junction) has been razed by B.R. and the level crossing, so a long traffic hold up has been replaced by a bridge. To the east of the railway line at (75.7l.4) are the remains of the old gas works. If one stands there on the site of l9th century technology and looks eastwards we can see the power stations that represent the technology of the 2Oth century. To the north of Lincoln Road at (74.4.7l.4) the Holy Well, little evidence of the well can now be seen, but footpaths to East Markham are still clear. The ribbon development along the roads appear to be coming to an end. The Al cuts the village N-S and is under repair today (a new hard shoulder is being built - 2nd July, l985).
